newsitem.title: TURKEY: Rocket hits Istanbul police HQ, far left blamed.
newsitem.headline: Rocket hits Istanbul police HQ, far left blamed.

text.p: Two assailants fired an anti-tank rocket at the main police headquarters in Istanbul, Turkey's biggest city, on Monday but there were no reports of casualties, officials said.
They said a man and a woman fired the rocket from the garden of a hospital across the road from the police station, in the centre of the city.
The pair fled, dropping the rocket launcher as well as gloves used to avoid leaving fingerprints.

Istanbul's chief of police, Ramazan Er, blamed the far-left Revolutionary People's Liberation Party-Front (DHKP-C) for the attack. The NTV channel quoted him as saying that four people, three men and one woman, had been arrested.
The rocket broke windows at the narcotics department on the fifth floor and blackened the building's outside wall, witnesses said.
The far left urban guerrillas of the DHKP-C earlier telephoned the Milliyet daily claiming responsibility for the attack, a spokesman for the paper told Reuters.
